title: Snow and Ice Warnings for the UK
summary: After lots of rain, cold weather is coming back to the UK. Snow and ice warnings are in place for Scotland and northern England from Thursday to Friday. Arctic air will make temperatures drop, and rain will turn to snow, especially on higher ground. Up to 10cm of snow might pile up above 200m. When the snow clears, it will get very cold, causing ice on roads and making driving dangerous. Health alerts are also issued to help protect vulnerable people from the cold. By Tuesday, temperatures should go back to normal. Remember to stay safe in the snow and ice!

background_read: This article talks about a weather change in the UK. After many days of rain, cold air from the Arctic is bringing snow and ice. Warnings are issued to keep people safe because snow can pile up and ice can make roads dangerous. Health alerts remind us to look after vulnerable people, like the elderly, during cold spells. By next week, the weather should improve. It's important to know how to stay safe in winter weather, like dressing warmly and driving carefully.
